listitem.para:
Install Fedora 18 Ubuntu with these parameters :
Time zone : UTC
Hostname : controller
Packages : OpenSSH-Server, wget
After OS Installation, reboot the server.

Since the default OpenStack release in Ubuntu 12.04 LTS is older, we are going to use the Ubuntu Cloud Archive for Grizzly :$ apt-get install ubuntu-cloud-keyringEdit /etc/apt/sources.list.d/cloud-archive.list :$ sudo deb http://ubuntu-cloud.archive.canonical.com/ubuntu precise-updates/grizzly main Upgrade the system (and reboot if you need) :$ sudo apt-get update && apt-get upgrade
Use the Fedora repositories for Grizzly :# wget http://rdo.fedorapeople.org/openstack/openstack-grizzly/fedora-openstack-grizzly.repo # mv fedora-openstack-grizzly.repo /etc/yum.repos.d/
Configure the network :
Edit /etc/network/interfaces file :

screen.userinput:
# Management Network auto eth0 iface eth0 inet static address 192.168.0.1 netmask 255.255.255.0
# API + Public Network auto eth1 iface eth1 inet static address 7.7.7.7 netmask 255.255.255.0 gateway 7.7.7.1 dns-nameservers 8.8.8.8

listitem.para:
Edit /etc/sysctl.conf :
net.ipv4.conf.all.rp_filter = 0 net.ipv4.conf.default.rp_filter = 0 Then, restart network service : service networking restart
Set up old ethernet nic device names:
Disable NetworkManager and enable the network service service NetworkManager stop service network start chkconfig NetworkManager off chkconfig network on
Edit the /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg-eth0 file:

screen.userinput: # Management Network DEVICE=eth0 TYPE=Ethernet BOOTPROTO=static IPADDR=192.168.0.1 NETMASK=255.255.255.0 DEFROUTE=yes ONBOOT=yes

listitem.para: Edit the /etc/sysconf/network-scripts/ifcfg-eth1 file :

screen.userinput: # API + Public Network DEVICE=eth1 TYPE=Ethernet BOOTPROTO=static IPADDR=7.7.7.7 NETMASK=255.255.255.0 GATEWAY=7.7.7.1 DNS=8.8.8.8 DEFROUTE=yes ONBOOT=yes

listitem.para: Reboot
Edit the /etc/hosts file and add controller, networknode and compute1 hostnames with correct IP.

Install Configure NTP :
Install the package: apt-get install -y ntpyum install -y ntp
Configure /etc/ntp.conf file:server ntp.ubuntu.com iburst server 127.127.1.0 fudge 127.127.1.0 stratum 10 server 0.fedora.pool.ntp.org iburst server 127.127.1.0 fudge 127.127.1.0 stratum 10
Restart the service: $ sudo service ntp restart # systemctl restart ntpd.service
Install the packages :$ sudo apt-get install python-mysqldb mysql-server# yum install mysql mysql-server MySQL-python
Allow connection from the network: sed -i 's/127.0.0.1/0.0.0.0/g' /etc/mysql/my.cnf sed -i 's/127.0.0.1/0.0.0.0/g' /etc/my.cnf
Restart the service: $ sudo service mysql restart # systemctl start mysqld.service # chkconfig mysqld on
Install the packages: $ apt-get install rabbitmq-server# yum install qpid-cpp-server
